channel.title: The Rogues' Gallery - The Ultimate Progressive Rock Podcast
channel.description: The Rogues' Gallery is a popular weekly progressive rock podcast featuring the latest music from all over the world! Recorded live with a chat audience every Thursday between 8 PM to Midnight (Pacific). Join us!
channel.itunes:subtitle: Weekly Podcast to Showcase New Progressive Rock Music.
channel.itunes:summary: The best new progressive rock, every week for your iPod! Recorded live with a chat audience every Thursday from 8-midnight pacific. Join us! http://www.thedividingline.com/rg
channel.itunes:author: Frans Keylard

image.title: The Rogues' Gallery - The Ultimate Progressive Rock Podcast

item.title: Rogues' Gallery Playlist March 12, 2011 - Show #346 - Progressive Rock Podcast
item.description:
Rogues' Gallery Playlist March 12, 2011 - Show #346 - Progressive Rock Podcast

Long show in the traditional RG style featuring an interview with Bob Madsen of 41POINT9 and a stunning preview of Sean Filkins' upcoming release!

Featuring:
41PONT9 - "Still Waiting for the Answers"
Sean Filkins - "War And Peace & Other Short Stories" PREVIEW
Magic Pie - "The Suffering Joy"
Finn Arild Aasheim - "Testament"
also: Heavy Water Experiments, Fadeout, Absinthe Junk, Sundomingo

PLAYLIST

2. Absinthe Junk - Road to Damnation (3:45)

23. SunDomingo - MadMaze (Feat. John Wesley) (5:33)

item.title: Rogues' Gallery Playlist November 27, 2010 - Show #343 - Progressive Rock Podcast
item.description:
Rogues' Gallery Playlist November 27, 2010 - Show #343 - Progressive Rock Podcast

Nine Stones Close Listening party featuring interviews with Adrian Jones (guitars, bass, keys and programming) and features Marc Atkinson (Mandalaband, Riversea) on vocals, Brendan Eyre (Riversea) on keyboards, Neil Quarrell on bass. Hear about the writing and recording of the album and how the Internet allowed the virtual band to come together. The album artwork was created by the incredible Ed Unitsky.

Special Pre-Order Offer
Pre-order Traces: http://bit.ly/TracesPreorder for £9.99 and get the Limited Edition Bonus CD "Re-Traced" FREE! ReTraced contains an additional 30+ minutes of music and is ONLY available with pre-orders though the band web site. If you would like your copy signed by Ade please mention it when you order!

PLAYLIST
1. Nine Stones Close - Reality Check (4:59)
2. Nine Stones Close - Threads (10:43)
3. Nine Stones Close - Falling To Pieces (6:14)
4. Nine Stones Close - Traces (7:17)

7. Nine Stones Close - Threads (acoustic) (5:38)

item.title: Rogues' Gallery Playlist Feb 18, 2010 - Show #331 - Progressive Rock Podcast
item.description:
Rogues' Gallery Playlist Feb 18, 2010 - Show #331 - Progressive Rock Podcast

This will be the last regular Rogues' Gallery for a while as I will be taking a hiatus from doing a weekly show. I will pirate now and again on weekend mornings when I have something to share, or a CD release party to do. :-)  I will announce it when it happens via the Dividing Line mailing list and Facebook.

I would like to thank all the listeners and contributors for your amazing support , it's been what has kept me going with 4 hour shows for nearly 7 years!  Until we meet again!

Featuring:
Vonassi - The Battle of Ego
RiverSea - track off a Benefit for Haiti CD featuring Adrian Jones (Nine Stones Close)

item.itunes:summary:
Rogues' Gallery Playlist Feb 18, 2010 - Show #331 - Progressive Rock Podcast
This will be the last regular Rogues' Gallery for a while as I will be taking a hiatus from doing a weekly show. I will pirate now and again on weekend mornings when I have something to share, or a CD release party to do. :-) I will announce it when it happens via the Dividing Line mailing list and Facebook.
I would like to thank all the listeners and contributors for your amazing support , it's been what has kept me going with 4 hour shows for nearly 7 years! Until we meet again!
Featuring: Vonassi - The Battle of Ego RiverSea - track off a Benefit for Haiti CD featuring Adrian Jones (Nine Stones Close)

item.title: Rogues' Gallery Playlist April 16, 2009 - Show #295 - Progressive Rock Podcast
item.description:
Rogues' Gallery Playlist April 16, 2009 - Show #295 - Progressive Rock Podcast

I had the honor of speaking with vocalist Jeff Hawks on the phone and bassist Bruce Hauser in the chat room about the self-titled album Touch, which was released in 1969 and is one of the first albums that laid the groundwork of what we now know as progressive rock. Touch has been lauded by many prog legends as an inspiration, yet nearly nothing is known about this band. You will hear an exploration of the band's roots, the process of making the album, and what happened to the band after they released what was to be their only album.  It's the 40th anniversary of Touch, let's celebrate this prog milestone! Big thanks to Smitty for setting it all up!

Prog it forward this week - El Stine will receive Singularity's "Between Sunlight and Shadow" from Wouter!

PLAYLIST
1. Gazpacho - Desert Flight (7:39)
2. Gazpacho - The Walk Part I (8:03)
3. Gazpacho - The Walk Part II (5:39)

item.description:
Rogues' Gallery Playlist April 9, 2009 - Show #294 - Progressive Rock Podcast

New music by O.S.I. "Blood," Queensryche "American Soldier," Mountain Mirrors "The Immortal Deadbeats EP."

Prog it forward this week - during the show there was a flurry of CDs changing hands, congrats to Ao for getting Mike Oldfield - "Five Miles Out" and "Discovery," Wouter got The Beatles - "1962 - 1966" and "1967 - 1970" (two double CD sets!), Christine got Simon and Garfunkel - "Bookends," and Annie got Peter Gabriel "Us."  Thanks again to the amazing anonymous prog benefactor, and to the new pledges of CDs! Keep 'em coming!

item.title: Rogues' Gallery Playlist April 2, 2009 - Show #293 - Progressive Rock Podcast
item.description:
Rogues' Gallery Playlist April 2, 2009 - Show #293 - Progressive Rock Podcast

New music by SAGA "The Human Condition," Roswell Six "Terra Incognita" and MarsupiaL "Genus Thylacinus."

Prog it forward this week - a triple set of Neal Morse (Morse Portnoy George - "Cover To Cover," Neal Morse - "Sola Scriptura," and Neal Morse - "ONE Demos." - if you are interested, send me an email and I will hook you up with the amazing anonymous prog benefactor!
